required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Gemcitabine-Cisplatin Chemotherapy Plus Necitumumab in the First-Line Treatment of Participants With Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Arm, Multicenter, Open-Label, Phase 2 Study of Gemcitabine-Cisplatin Chemotherapy Plus Necitumumab (IMC-11F8) in the First-Line Treatment of Patients With Stage IV Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration
South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)
Mexico: Federal Commission for Protection Against Health Risks
Netherlands: Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see how participants with late stage lung cancer do on gemcitabine-cisplatin chemotherapy plus necitumumab. The study will also see how safe the drugs are in combination and to see how long the medicine stays in the body. The study will last approximately 2 years.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Achieve Best Overall Tumor Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) [Objective Tumor Response Rate (ORR)]
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Measured Progressive Disease (Estimated up to 24 Months)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Death from Any Cause (Estimated up to 27 Months)
Baseline to Measured Progressive Disease or Death from Any Cause (Estimated up to 24 Months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Achieve Best Overall Disease Response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) [Disease Control Rate (DCR)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Measured Progressive Disease or Participants Stops Study (Estimated up to 24 Months)
Baseline until Measured Progressive Disease (Estimated up to 24 Months)
Predose up to 24 Hours Post Dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Anti-Necitumumab Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 Days Post Last Infusion (Estimated up to 24 Months)

arm_group.description: Necitumumab administered intravenously (IV) 800 milligram (mg) on Days 1 and 8 of each 3-week cycle. Gemcitabine administered IV at 1250 milligram per square meter (mg/m^2) on Days 1 and 8 of each 3 week cycle for a maximum of 6 cycles. Cisplatin administered IV at 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 3 week cycle for a maximum of 6 cycles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed squamous Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
- Stage IV disease at time of study entry based on American Joint Committee on Cancer 7th edition
- Measurable disease at time of study entry as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), Version 1.1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nonsquamous NSCLC
- Prior anticancer therapy with monoclonal antibodies, signal transduction inhibitors, or any therapies targeting the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR), vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), or VEGF receptor
- Previous chemotherapy for NSCLC
- Major surgery or received any investigational therapy in the 4 weeks prior to study enrollment
- Chest irradiation within 12 weeks prior to randomization (except palliative irradiation of bone lesions, which is allowed)
- Brain metastases that are symptomatic or require ongoing treatment with steroids or anticonvulsants (participants who have undergone previous radiotherapy for brain metastases, who are now nonsymptomatic and no longer require treatment with steroids or anticonvulsants, are eligible)
